content.description: Was project X1 in Jeff's book, finishes on corner climber's right of shown route in book.   Start in the obvious steep sea polished corner then when the corner ends cut left into a nice crack. When the crack ends, go right off a tufa fin onto more steep fins. Underclings and pinches lead to a final corner. Small cams in seams helpful. Scary. Don't fall off the final corner!! Use the same anchor as sedated
content.location: Was project X1 in Jeff's book.   1st route in the cavern climbers left.

climbs.name: Transatlantic
climbs.fa: FA Jeff Butterfield FFA Tim Kemple

content.description: Pitch one: Climb out a roof with tech moves on. Cool features. There’s better gear than what appears from the ground. Pitch two: Start up a face, clipping three bolts, then move into a roof. Climb out the roof into an insecure corner to a jug. Wild moves out right lead to a pumpy finish on not so positive holds. Amazing exposure!! Such a killer pitch!
content.protection: Gear on first pitch, 11 bolts on second. Fix a rope to Dragon Fish and bring ascenders

content.description: The amazing crack that splits the sea polished overhanging shield and ends at huge trophy cup jug, climbers right of project X2 in the book, traverse climbers left to a bolted anchor. The gear looks decent.
content.location: Just climbers right of project X2 in the book.

content.description: An exposed step right off the hanging belay takes you to the first bolt. Fun face climbing through one more bolt and power into an undercling traverse. Get further and further from your gear as you round the arete and into a corner with three bolts. Follow this to the top and a two bolt anchor. Rad!
content.protection: 5 bolts and medium sized cams or nuts
content.location: Center of cavern. Use a short .10a approach pitch to access hanging belay.

content.description:
Rappel in with a fixed line to a belay. Then climb the obvious and radically steep prow. Amazing boulder problem to start then endurance and tech to the top. Hands down one of the most amazing hard 5.12's in New England!!! 

  Was Project X4 in Jeff's Guide. 

  Warning: You need a low-tide or small surf. Fix a line and know how to jug before attempting. Slightly scary. Hard.
content.location: Climbers right of the main cavern

content.description:
Was project X3 in Jeff's book. The start is the crux. Bouldery moves on sea polished crimps go into radically steep fins and underclings. Continue bouldering out a body length horizontal roof on a stalactite tooth feature; very strange (V8ish?). After moving through the sea polished roof and statactite, climb through an amazing pocket covered face on a slightly overhanging wall to an another roof. Boulder through this roof into a technical corner. Hang on to the top. Absolutely amazing. No doubt one of the best 5.13's in Maine and the NE! Full value.

 Warning: fix a line on Transatlantic, bring some jugs, know the surf report. Not affected by tide, but affected when the swell is pumping. Stick clip the first bolt or hang them on the way down.
content.location: Was project X3 in Jeff's Guide.   Start way back in the cave!

content.description: The large amphitheater in the center of the cliff. The most tide dependent section of the cliff as well as the steepest.  Home to some of the islands hardest routes and some open projects as well.
